feature_description: Create a backup copy with timestamp in filename
env_setup:
Initial clean-up
Execute rm -r ~/Desktop/oi/* to start with fresh test directory.
mkdir -p ~/Desktop/oi/Projects
echo "This is an important project plan document." > ~/Desktop/oi/Projects/project_plan.txt
prompt: Can you create a backup of the project_plan.txt file in ~/Desktop/oi/Projects directory? Make sure the backup includes today's date in the filename.
expected_behaviour: The agent should create a copy of the project_plan.txt file with a timestamp in the filename (e.g., project_plan_2023-10-25.txt). It should use the cp command with date formatting and confirm the successful creation of the backup file in the same directory. Achieving a similar outcome using any reasonable method is perfectly acceptable.
